Code documentation¶

Main module¶

This is the main module of the tool that holds all the functionalities for the GUI.

This module contains all the functions and signal-slots methods for GUI navigation, data loading and processing, graphical representation, fitting and statistical analysis.

Classes

MyMainWindow

The main class of the project that create the GUI with all the functionalities

class pyg_back.MyMainWindow(parent=None)¶

The central class of the project that holds all functionalities and distributes them across the GUI

This MyMainWindow class inherits from QMainWindow (PyQt5) and Ui_MainWindow (pyg_ui.py) classes. It holds every features from GUI navigation to the last step of statistical analysis.

boxplot_gc(y)¶

Boxplot for germination parameters

This function helps create a boxplot for germination parameters, possibly with a group order set by the user

Parameters

  • y (str) – A germination parameter

  • data (pandas.Dataframe) – A dataset to analyze

  • order (list) – An ordered list of group levels

  • boxplot_title (str) – The main title we want for the plot

  • mydirectory (A path) – The user defined working directory

Returns

A matplotlib boxplot

Returns

A .tiff file of the plot exported into the working directory

copySelection(table)¶
error_gc(text)¶

Error message generator

Two parameters have to be given. A first string that provides the nature of error and a second that may guide to a solution

Parameters

text (str) – Error type, origins and advices

Returns

An error message box

eventFilter(self, QObject, QEvent) → bool¶
hill_function(x, a, b, c, yo)¶

The 4 parameters Hill function (4PHF)

This is the mathematical model best fit to adjust experimental germination sigmoid curves.

Parameters

  • x (float) – Time

  • a (float) – Final level

  • b (float) – Shape of the curve

  • c (float) – Inflection point of the sigmoid curve

  • yo (float) – Initial level

Returns

y (germination level in our case)

image_display_gc(file, object)¶

Display an image into a widget

Here a saved tiff file is used to generate an image object that is transformed before being displayed in a specific GUI widget

Parameters

  • file (str) – A tiff file in the working directory

  • object (PyQt5 widget) – A display widget in the GUI

Returns

A display

information_gc(text)¶

Warning message generator

Two parameters have to be given. A first string that provides the primary information and a second to possibly complete the message

Parameters

text (str) – An information, a tip to provide

Returns

A informative message box

on_anova_page6_clicked()¶

Anova analysis

An usual group comparison is performed with the pingouin package anova method to better characterize the overall variation of every germination parameters.

Parameters

  • comboBox_page6 (str) – A selected gerrmination parameter

  • df_germ_parameters_transfo (pandas.Dataframe) – The dataframe of individual germination parameters with an arcsine transformation on Gmax percentages data

Returns

A pandas dataframe of anova’s outputs

on_calcul_page2_clicked()¶

Germination percents calculation

Generate the germination percent matrix from the raw counts data, on calcul_page2 push. The percent data are displayed in tableView_page2 output, in a heatmap style.

Parameters

df_raw (pandas.Dataframe) – The first level data of raw germination counts

Returns

A pandas dataframe containing the percent data required for the next steps of analysis

Returns

The time serie of the germination test

on_calcul_page4_clicked()¶

Fitting step

Every germination curve will be adjusted with the 4 parameters Hill function, with a parameters calculation that starts from initial entered values to final optimized ones, once they converged. These final parameters values give a model that best fit the experimental data from which it will be possible to extract germination parameters.

Parameters

  • textEdit1_page4 (float) – initial value for a, overall final germination percent

  • textEdit2_page4 (float) – initial value for b, curves shape

  • textEdit3_page4 (float) – initial value for c, overall time to reach 50% of germination

  • textEdit4_page4 (float) – initial value for y0, germination percent at experiment start

  • textEdit5_page4 (float) – Time span

  • df_percent (pandas.Dataframe) – The restricted germination percent matrix

  • time_serie (list) – The temporal sequence of the germination test

Returns

The dataframe of fitted parameters for the all seeds samples

Returns

A thumbnail of the matplotlib graph of adjustments

on_courbe_groupe_page3_clicked()¶

Grouped germination curves display

The group means and standard deviation is used to plot germination curves by group of replicates. Matplotlib windows are used to display the graph and a miniature inside the GUI keeps track of it.

Parameters

  • df_percent_final (pandas.Dataframe) – The germination percents matrix with samples metadata

  • textEdit2_page3 (str) – A plot title

Returns

A matplotlib graph in an external window

Returns

A thumbnail of the matplotlib plot

on_courbe_ind_page3_clicked()¶

Display individual germination curves

From the percents matrix, germination curves are plotted for each seeds sample, for the duration of the test. Matplotlib windows are used to display the graph and a miniature inside the GUI keeps track of it.

Parameters

  • df_percent (pandas.Dataframe) – The restricted germination percents matrix

  • time_serie (list) – The temporal sequence of the germination test

  • df_percent_final (pandas.Dataframe) – The complete germination percents dataframe with qualitative data

  • textEdit1_page3 (str) – A plot title

Returns

A matplotlib graph in a external window

Returns

A thumbnail of the matplotlib plot

on_courbe_page4_clicked()¶

Adjustement curves in a matplotlib window

Display a window for the matplotlib graph of germination curves adjustement, with a linear interpolation. For the graph to be possibly saved.

Parameters

adj_curves (matplotlib object) – The adjustement curves basic plot

Returns

A matplotlib graph in a external window

on_dir_page1_clicked()¶

Working directory selection

Open a window to select a working directory, by clicking dir_page1 push button.

Returns

A path to the selected working directory

on_export1_page6_clicked()¶

Export of statistical results in a csv file

Depending of the displayed results in the GUI, either the anova or the post-hoc tests results are exported in a .csv format, into the working directory by default, or in a newly selected folder.

Parameters

mydirectory (str) – A selected working directory

Returns

A .csv file

on_export2_page6_clicked()¶

Export of summary results in a csv file

Export in a .csv format the whole table displayed above. This table summarize all the potential p-values of the statistical analysis.

Parameters

mydirectory (str) – A selected working directory

Returns

A .csv file

on_export_page2_clicked()¶

Germination percents export

Open a dialog to save a file, once export_page2 pushed.

Parameters

df_percent_final (pandas.Dataframe) – The germination percents matrix with samples metadata

Returns

A .csv file

on_export_page4_clicked()¶

Germination parameters tables export

Here we can save the data in .csv files

Parameters

mydirectory (str) – A selected working directory

Returns

A .csv file

on_import_page1_clicked()¶

Data import, display and QC

Clicking the import_page1 push button opens a window to select a file of raw counts to analyze . The intended format is csv. A file is loaded into session, its content is displayed in a table view and summary statistics are calculated.

Parameters

  • mydirectory (str) – A path

  • file_name (str) – A .csv file

Returns

A pandas dataframe containing the raw data (first level of data)

Returns

QC data

on_multcomp_page6_clicked()¶

Multiple comparisons (post-hoc tests)

The pingouin pairwise_ttests function allows to compare the group levels pairwise, with a Benjamini Hochberg fdr correction of p-values. The results are used to better characterize the origins of the overall variations as seen in anova.

Parameters

  • comboBox_page6 (str) – A selected germination parameter

  • df_germ_parameters_transfo (pandas.Dataframe) – The dataframe of individual germination parameters with an arcsine transformation on Gmax percentages data

Returns

A pandas dataframe with all the multiple comparisons results

on_param_groupe_page4_clicked()¶

Germination parameters by group

Group means are calculated for every parameter to facilitate groups comparison.

Parameters

df_germ_parameters (pandas.Dataframe) – The germination parameters data for every sample

Returns

The mean germination parameters for every group

on_param_ind_page4_clicked()¶

Individual germination parameters calculation

The germination parameters will be extracted from the adjustement model fitted parameters.

Parameters

  • df_fittedParameters (pandas.Dataframe) – The dataframe of fitted parameters by seeds sample

  • self.xmax (float) – The time span of experiment

Returns

A daframe of the 5 germination parameters (Gmax,t1,t50,D, AUC) for every seeds sample

Move to page7

on_pushButton_page5_clicked()¶

Minimal boxplots for germination parameters

By clicking pushButton_page5, boxplots are created for the parameter selected in comboBox_page5. A title can be added by filling textEdit_page5. The boxplots are displayed in matplotlib windows and a GUI thumbnail appears.

Parameters

  • comboBox_page5 (str) – A selected germination parameter

  • textEdit_page5 (str) – A boxplot title

Returns

A boxplot in a matplotlib window

Returns

A boxplot thumbnail inside the GUI

on_pushButton_page7_clicked()¶

Tukey boxplots for germination parameters

Here the Tukey boxplots with multiple comparison data will be created, for a selected parameter, possibly with an entered main title, by clicking pushButton_page7. The plot is first displayed in a matplotlib window but also as a thumbnail in the GUI.

Parameters

  • comboBox_page7 (str) – A selected germination parameter

  • df_germ_parameters (pandas.Dataframe) – The individual germination parameters dataframe

Returns

A Tukey boxplot in a matplotlib window

Returns

A thumbnail of the plot inside the GUI

on_summary_page6_clicked()¶

A method that compute all the statistical test to generate a summary

Here all Anova and all multiple comparisons for the whole germination parameters are in one shot performed in order to generate a table that gather the corresponding p-values as guidelines for interpretations.

Parameters

  • df_germ_parameters_transfo (pandas.Dataframe) – The dataframe of individual germination parameters with an arcsine transformation on Gmax percentages data

  • textEdit_page6 (float) – A value between 0 and 1 given to define a threshold to highlight p-values in the summary table

Returns

A pandas dataframe with the whole possible p-values

on_validation_page1_clicked()¶

Groups ordering

The group levels order is entered in textEdit4_page1 widget. The levels have to be separated by a return. The ordered list is created once validation_page1 push button is pressed.

Parameters

levels_order (list) – Custom group levels sorting for following boxplots

Returns

An ordered list of levels

optimized_hill_function(x)¶

The Hill function with extracted parameters from fitting

This function is used to compute the estimated germination levels ( percents) along time from an optimized model that fits the experimental data

Parameters

  • x (float) – Time

  • fittedParameters (float) – Fitting parameters

Returns

estimation of y

t_boxplot_gc(y)¶

A function for Tukey boxplot (with pairwise comparisons results)

With this function we can easily generate boxplots of germination parameters with an additionnal data from the pairwise post_hoc tests, namely the list of p-values from all comparisons. This gives an higher insight into the nature of variations.

Parameters

  • y (str) – A germination parameter

  • data (pandas.Dataframe) – The individual germination parameters table

  • order (list) – A user-defined order for the group levels

  • boxplot_title (str) – A main title for the plot

  • groups_couple (list) – A list of pairwise comparisons

  • posthoc (pandas.Dataframe) – A dataframe containing the post-hoc tests results

  • selected_param (str) – A selected germination parameter

Returns

A Tukey boxplot in a matplotlib window

Returns

A .tiff file of the Tukey boxplot

GUI module¶

This is the GUI module.

This module creates and configures all the objects required by the interface. All GUI controls are designed in this module inside its unique class Ui_MainWindow that is used inside the project main class MyMainWindow. The overall widgets are shared out 7 pages of interface.

Classes

Ui_MainWindow

The GUI class of the project that design the interface on 7 pages

Dependencies
PyQt5

5.15.1

class pyg_ui.Ui_MainWindow¶

The related class of the project that produces the GUI

This class is used by the main one to generate the 7 pages of the GUI and all the input and output controls. Its is mainly written thanks to PyQt5 designer software that converted a graphically build interface into a python code within this class Ui_MainWindow. Just a few manual adjustments were done on the code produced by PyQt5 designer from our custom-made interface.

retranslateUi(MainWindow)¶
setupUi(MainWindow)¶

Tables display module¶

This module contains 2 dataframe models dedicated to unique display of tables inside the GUI.

This module contains 2 different classes. The first one TableModel_1 enables an usual display of tables with text data with a green background and numeric data in yellow. The second one TableModel_2 is dedicated to germination percent data with heatmap gradients making easier to read these data.

Classes

TableModel_1

The main model for displaying tables inside de GUI. It is used to display raw germination data, germination parameters and statistics.

Classes

TableModel_2

A second model for displaying table with an heatmap style to represent percent data in a clearer way.

Classes

TableModel_3

A third model for displaying tables with a red highlight of cells containing a float below a user-defined threshold.

Dependencies
PyQt5

5.15.1

numpy

1.19.2

matplotlib

3.3.3

class DataFrameModel.TableModel_3(data, threshold)¶

TableModel_3 for a thresholded display

This class is similar the TableModel_1, but the background color of a cell will be highlighted in red if its pvalue is lower than a user-defined threshold. It has to be defined inside the GUI.

columnCount(self, parent: QModelIndex = QModelIndex()) → int¶

External ressources module¶

This module is dedicated to external ressources integration.

In our interface this module is used to integrate a single image in page 4 of the interface. This is the image that helps illustrate the computed germination parameters on a theorical germination curve.

Dependencies
PyQt5

5.15.1

pyg_ressources_rc.qCleanupResources()¶
pyg_ressources_rc.qInitResources()¶

CSS stylesheet¶

The stylesheet of the GUI

This module helps design the appearance of the GUI and its controls thanks to css and html instructions. It notably enables to configure the widgets by type, obtaining this way a consistent style all across the interface. This template has been downloaded from the qss-stock website (https://qss-stock.devsecstudio.com/index.php). By large it’s a dark orange style with many customizations. Some features has been manually added to reach expectations.
